{{Infobox football biography | playername = Adama Coulibaly | image = [[Image:Adama Coulibaly.jpg|200px]] | caption = | fullname = Adama Coulibaly | dateofbirth = {{Birth date and age|1980|9|10}} | cityofbirth = [[Bamako]] | countryofbirth = [[Mali]] | height = {{convert|1.86|m|ftin|abbr=on}} | position = [[Defender (football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] | clubnumber = 6 | years1 = 1998â1999 | clubs1 = [[Djoliba AC|Djoliba]] | caps1 = 20 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 1999â2008 | clubs2 = [[RC Lens|Lens]] | caps2 = 190 | goals2 = 9 | years3 = 2008â | clubs3 = [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] | caps3 = 101 | goals3 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2001â | nationalteam1 = [[Mali national football team|Mali]] | nationalcaps1 = 46 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | club-update = 29 May 2011 | nationalteam-update = 12:06, 22 November 2009 (UTC) }} '''Adama Coulibaly''' (born 10 September, 1980) is a [[Mali]]an [[football (soccer)]] [[defender (football)|defender]]. He was born in [[Bamako]], [[Mali]], and began his career in his local club, [[Djoliba AC]]. Coulibaly recently transferred to [[AJ Auxerre]] after spending a [[decade]] with his former club [[RC Lens]]. The transfer fee was priced at 2 million [[euro]]s.<ref>[http://www.transfermarketweb.com/?action=read&idsel=18272 OFFICIAL, Adama Coulibaly to Auxerre]</ref> He has played international matches for [[Mali national football team|Mali]] along with his cousin [[Moussa Coulibaly (footballer born 1981)|Moussa Coulibaly]].
== Honors and awards == * [[FIFA World Youth Championship]] 3rd place: 1999
